content: summer tote designed by merri purdy/purdy sweet crochet https //www ravelry com/designers/merri-purdy merripurdy@verizon net summercal 2024 purdysweetcrochet facebookgroup ©copyrightmerripurdy/purdysweetcrochet2024 allrightsreserved thereproductionandpublishingofthispa�ernormaterialwithoutpermissionisprohibited itemscreatedwiththispa�ernmaybesold butpleaseremembertocredit merripurdy/purdysweetcrochet materials k & c cotton essentials - 5 skeins 1 in each of 5 different colors sample colors used ● color a - charcoal ● color b - rainforest ● color c - earth green ● color d - rose garden ● color e - cream 5 0 mm crochet hook 4 0 mm crochet hook 1 button stitch markers tapestry needle gauge not essential to the design finished bag dimensions 14 wide x 11 high stitches/abbreviations chain chain half_double_crochet half_double_crochet fpdc front post double_crochet bpdc back post double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch skip skip pattern notes ● this bag is made using two strands of yarn held together throughout ● feel free to adjust the hook to accommodate your personal crochet gauge ● any cotton yarn may be used for this project ● finished size will vary based on yarn choice hook size and personal crochet gauge cal part 1 - bag base using color a and color b foundation round 1 with colors a and b held together chain 33 work 3 half_double_crochet in the second chain from hook place a st marker in both the 1st and 3rd half_double_crochet st continue to work 1 half_double_crochet in each chain across 30 xs until one chain remains work 3 half_double_crochet sts in the last chain and as before place a st marker in the 1st and 3rd half_double_crochet st of this group work around to the opposite side of the foundation chain by placing 1 half_double_crochet in each of the front loops 30 half_double_crochet until you reach the 1st st marker of the round as i worked along the second side of the foundation chain i worked right over my starting tail 66 round 2 without joining place 2 half_double_crochet in each of the first 3 sts move markers up to the 1st and 6th st half_double_crochet 30 to the next marked st place 2 half_double_crochet in each of the next 3 sts moving markers up to the 1st and 6th st half_double_crochet 30 to the first marked st of the round 72 round 3 without joining place 2 half_double_crochet in each of the first 6 sts move markers up to the 1st and 12th st half_double_crochet 30 to the next marked st place 2 half_double_crochet in each of the next 6 sts moving markers up to the 1st and 12th st half_double_crochet 30 to first marked st of the round 84 round 4 without joining place 2 half_double_crochet in the first marked st move marker up to first of the 2 half_double_crochet sts half_double_crochet 10 2hdc in next st remove marker and set aside half_double_crochet 30 to the next marked st place 2 half_double_crochet in marked st remove marker and set aside half_double_crochet 10 2 half_double_crochet in next stitch remove marker half_double_crochet 30 to first marked st of the round 88 round 5 without
